Package gdi.game.sprite

Class Sprite

java.lang.Object
gdi.game.WorldObject
gdi.game.Drawable
gdi.game.sprite.Sprite
All Implemented Interfaces:
gdi.game.DrawableObject, gdi.game.UpdatableObject
Direct Known Subclasses:
MapSprite
public class Sprite extends gdi.game.Drawable
This class represents an Object that can move freely over the world. It stores a location in the 2D-World as well as a rotation. It also provides methods to animate the Sprite or add Constraints. This class provides some useful hooks you may want to override for specific tasks:
  • didAddToWorld(AbstractSpriteWorld)
  • willRemoveFromWorld(AbstractSpriteWorld)
  • animationDidFinish(AbstractAnimation)
Version:
1.0
Author:
frank

  • Constructor Details

    • Sprite

      public Sprite(gdi.game.sprite.AbstractSpriteWorld w)
      Creates a new Sprite that can be used in the passed word
      Parameters:
      w - The world you want to use the sprite in

    • Sprite

      public Sprite(double x, double y, gdi.game.sprite.AbstractSpriteWorld w)
      Creates a new Sprite at a given location in the passed world.
      Parameters:
      x - Abscissa in the 2D-Coordinate space of the world (position along the horizontal axis with 0 on the outermost left edge)
      y - Ordinate in the 2D-Coordinate space of the world (position along the vertical axis with 0 on the topmost edge with values growing towards the bottom)
      w - The world you want to use the sprite in

    • Sprite

      public Sprite(double x, double y, double angle, gdi.game.sprite.AbstractSpriteWorld w)
      Creates a new Sprite at a given location in the passed world.
      Parameters:
      x - Abscissa in the 2D-Coordinate space of the world (position along the horizontal axis with 0 on the outermost left edge)
      y - Ordinate in the 2D-Coordinate space of the world (position along the vertical axis with 0 on the topmost edge with values growing towards the bottom)
      angle - The rotation of the sprite in degrees
      w - The world you want to use the sprite in

    • didAddToWorld

      public void didAddToWorld(gdi.game.sprite.AbstractSpriteWorld w)
      This hook is called when the Sprite is added to the world. When the sprite is created it is only associated with the passed world but not assigned to it. This is useful when preloading lots of objects that need to be shown right away but at some later point in time.
      Parameters:
      w - The world the sprite was added to. This is always the same world as returned by WorldObject.getWorld().
      See Also:
      • AbstractSpriteWorld.addSprite(Sprite)

    • willRemoveFromWorld

      public void willRemoveFromWorld(gdi.game.sprite.AbstractSpriteWorld w)
      This hook is called when the Sprite is removed from the world. A sprite can be removed from (or added to) its associated world at any time. This is useful when you want to temporarily deactivate or hide a certain sprite.
      Parameters:
      w - The world the sprite was removed from. This is always the same world as returned by WorldObject.getWorld().
      See Also:
      • AbstractSpriteWorld.removeSprite(Sprite)

    • render

      public final void render(Graphics2D g)
      The render call that is invoked when this sprite needs to get rendered. The call will make sure that the corrdinate space of the Context passed in g is transformed to the local coordinate space of the sprite (translation and rotation) before calling renderLocal(Graphics2D). After that call the original coordinate space is restored. Override renderLocal(Graphics2D) for your custom drawing of your sprites.
      Parameters:
      g - The graphics context this sprite should draw to
      See Also:
      • DrawableObject.render(Graphics2D)
      • renderLocal(Graphics2D)

    • render

      public final void render(Graphics2D g, Point localLocation)
      Same as render(Graphics2D) but with an explicit definition of the sprites current location. This method is used in MapSprite to render tiles in the local coordinate frame of teh Tile
      Parameters:
      g - The graphics context this sprite should draw to
      localLocation - The location of the sprite expressed in the currently valid space. In map space this would equal getLocation().

    • update

      public void update(double deltaTime, double time)
      The update implementation for Spirtes. This implementation handles all updates needed by animations and constraints. When you override this method, make sure to invoke super. Without it, any AbstractAnimation or Constraint applied to this Sprite will stop working.
      This method will first update all Animations (by calling AbstractAnimation.update(double, double)) followed by update requests to all Constraints (by calling Constraint.updateSprite(double)).
      Parameters:
      deltaTime - The time passed since the last update call
      time - The game time the new update cycle was started at
      See Also:
      • UpdatableObject.update(double, double)

    • removeConstraint

      public final void removeConstraint(gdi.game.constraints.Constraint c)
      Removes the passed constraint from the Sprite. Once a constraint was removed it can not be added back to the Object since addConstraint(Constraint) is not accessible from outside the object
      Parameters:
      c - The Constraint you wish to remove.

    • clearConstraints

      public final void clearConstraints()
      Removes all constraints added to this Sprite.

    • addLookatConstraint

      public final void addLookatConstraint(double smoothness)
      Adds a LookAtConstraint to this sprite. The Look-At Constraint ensures, that an Object is always facing into the direction it is moving.
      Parameters:
      smoothness - How fast should the rotation of the sprite adapt to a change in direction (low values=fast changes)
      See Also:
      • LookAtConstraint(Sprite, double)

    • animationDidFinish

      public void animationDidFinish(gdi.game.animations.AbstractAnimation anim)
      This hook is called whenever an animation did finish. This implementation makes sure that a finished animation is automatically removed from the Sprite.
      Parameters:
      anim - The animation that did finish its playback

    • addAnimation

      public final gdi.game.animations.AbstractAnimation addAnimation(gdi.game.animations.AbstractAnimation anim)
      Adds an animation to the sprite. The animation is added but playback is not automatically started. For convenice the Method returns the Animation passed in anim.
      Parameters:
      anim - The animation that should get added
      Returns:
      The Animation that was passed as an Argument

    • removeAnimation

      public final void removeAnimation(gdi.game.animations.AbstractAnimation a)
      Removes an animation from the sprite.
      Parameters:
      a - The animation you wish to remove.

    • clearAnimations

      public final void clearAnimations()
      Removes all animations from the sprite.

    • hasAnimations

      public final boolean hasAnimations()
      Test whether or not the sprite has currently active animations
      Returns:
      True if an animation is still playing

    • moveTo

      public void moveTo(double x, double y, double deltaTime, boolean smooth, gdi.game.animations.AbstractAnimation.Delegate delegateOrNull)
      Creates an animation that moves the sprite form its current position to the specified location. This method will internally create two Instances of KeyframeAnimation to change the x and y positions over time. The animations are started synchronous.
      Parameters:
      x - The targeted horizontal position
      y - The targeted vertical position
      deltaTime - The time the animation should run. If this value is negative it is interpreted as a speed in pixels/second
      smooth - true if the animation should ease in and out (see KeyframeAnimation.Smooth and KeyframeAnimation.smooth(boolean))
      delegateOrNull - An object that is notified once the animation starts and stops.

    • moveTo

      public void moveTo(List<gdi.util.math.Vec2D> locations, double deltaTime, boolean smooth, gdi.game.animations.AbstractAnimation.Delegate delegateOrNull)
      Creates an animation that moves the sprite form its current position to the specified location. This method will internally create two Instances of KeyframeAnimation to change the x and y positions over time. The animations are started synchronous.
      This Method will ignore all waypoints that do not change with respect to the previous waypoint.
      Parameters:
      locations - a list of Positions
      deltaTime - The time the animation should run between two consecutive locations. If this value is negative it is interpreted as a speed in pixels/second
      smooth - true if the animation should ease in and out (see KeyframeAnimation.Smooth and KeyframeAnimation.smooth(boolean))
      delegateOrNull - An object that is notified once the animation starts and stops.

    • rotateTo

      public final void rotateTo(double angle, double deltaTime, boolean smooth, gdi.game.animations.AbstractAnimation.Delegate delegateOrNull)
      Creates an animation that rotates the sprite to a given angle. This method will internally create an Instances of KeyframeAnimation to change the angle over time. The animation is automatically started
      Parameters:
      angle - The targeted angle
      deltaTime - he time the animation should run.
      smooth - true if the animation should ease in and out (see KeyframeAnimation.Smooth and KeyframeAnimation.smooth(boolean))
      delegateOrNull - An object that is notified once the animation starts and stops.

    • animateX

      public final gdi.game.animations.AbstractAnimation animateX(ArrayList<gdi.game.animations.Keyframe> keyframes, boolean smooth, boolean offsetAnimation, gdi.game.animations.AbstractAnimation.Delegate delegateOrNull)
      Add an animation that changes the horizontal position of the Sprite. The animation will not start playback automatically. This method will internally create an Instances of KeyframeAnimation that is hooked (using hookX()) to the Abscissa of the Sprite.
      Parameters:
      keyframes - The positions the object should pass at given times.
      smooth - true if the animation should ease in and out (see KeyframeAnimation.Smooth and KeyframeAnimation.smooth(boolean))
      offsetAnimation - true if the keyFrame values should get added to the position the sprite had when the animation starts
      delegateOrNull - An object that is notified once the animation starts and stops.
      Returns:
      The created animation object
      See Also:
      • hookX()
      • Linear(World, gdi.game.animations.AbstractAnimation.Delegate, Hook, ArrayList, boolean)
      • KeyframeAnimation.smooth(boolean)

    • animateY

      public final gdi.game.animations.AbstractAnimation animateY(ArrayList<gdi.game.animations.Keyframe> keyframes, boolean smooth, boolean offsetAnimation, gdi.game.animations.AbstractAnimation.Delegate delegateOrNull)
      Add an animation that changes the vertical position of the Sprite. The animation will not start playback automatically. This method will internally create an Instances of KeyframeAnimation that is hooked (using hookY()) to the Ordinate of the Sprite.
      Parameters:
      keyframes - The positions the object should pass at given times.
      smooth - true if the animation should ease in and out (see KeyframeAnimation.Smooth and KeyframeAnimation.smooth(boolean))
      offsetAnimation - true if the keyFrame values should get added to the position the sprite had when the animation starts
      delegateOrNull - An object that is notified once the animation starts and stops.
      Returns:
      The created animation object
      See Also:
      • hookY()
      • Linear(World, gdi.game.animations.AbstractAnimation.Delegate, Hook, ArrayList, boolean)
      • KeyframeAnimation.smooth(boolean)

    • animateAngle

      public final gdi.game.animations.AbstractAnimation animateAngle(ArrayList<gdi.game.animations.Keyframe> keyframes, boolean smooth, boolean offsetAnimation, gdi.game.animations.AbstractAnimation.Delegate delegateOrNull)
      Add an animation that changes the angle of the Sprite. The animation will not start playback automatically. This method will internally create an Instances of KeyframeAnimation that is hooked (using hookAngle()) to the Ordinate of the Sprite.
      Parameters:
      keyframes - The positions the object should pass at given times.
      smooth - true if the animation should ease in and out (see KeyframeAnimation.Smooth and KeyframeAnimation.smooth(boolean))
      offsetAnimation - true if the keyFrame values should get added to the position the sprite had when the animation starts
      delegateOrNull - An object that is notified once the animation starts and stops.
      Returns:
      The created animation object
      See Also:
      • hookAngle()
      • Linear(World, gdi.game.animations.AbstractAnimation.Delegate, Hook, ArrayList, boolean)

    • hookX

      public final gdi.game.animations.Hook.Sprite.PosX hookX()
      Returns an animation Hook for the Abscissa. The Hook is used to link the calculated values of an AbstractAnimation-Object to the value of the horizontal position of the sprite changing it during the playback of the animation.
      Returns:
      A hook for the horizontal Position of the sprite

    • hookY

      public final gdi.game.animations.Hook.Sprite.PosY hookY()
      Returns an animation Hook for the Ordinate. The Hook is used to link the calculated values of an AbstractAnimation-Object to the value of the vertical position of the sprite changing it during the playback of the animation.
      Returns:
      A hook for the vertical Position of the sprite

    • hookAngle

      public final gdi.game.animations.Hook.Sprite.Angle hookAngle()
      Returns an animation Hook for the angle. The Hook is used to link the calculated values of an AbstractAnimation-Object to the value of the rotation of the sprite changing it during the playback of the animation.
      Returns:
      A hook for the rotation of the sprite
